overview_of_class: This course examines the structure and function of formal organizations, especially in business and government. Topics include stratification, social control, conflict, discretion, rules, information in achieving goals, and modes of participation. This course combines classroom lecture and discussion with an online component in a five-week intensive format. In-class sessions will be held on 11/5, 11/19, 12/10. This course is part of the Business Leadership year two cohort. First class attendance is mandatory.
name: Sociology of Organizations
